questions.question: What is Vue JS?
options: A backend framework
A frontend framework
A database management system
A programming language
questions.answer: A frontend framework

questions.question: What is the Vue instance?
options: The entry point of a Vue app
The main component of a Vue app
A configuration object for a Vue app
A JavaScript class for a Vue app
questions.answer: The entry point of a Vue app

questions.question: What is a Vue component?
options: A template for rendering HTML
A JavaScript class for managing state
A reusable piece of code for rendering HTML
A configuration object for a Vue app
questions.answer: A reusable piece of code for rendering HTML

questions.question: What is a Vue directive?
options: A function that manipulates the DOM
A function that manipulates the state
A function that handles events
A function that renders HTML

questions.question: What is the Vue router?

A tool for managing browser history
A tool for managing database queries
A tool for managing network requests

questions.question: What is Vuex in Vue JS?
options: A state management pattern and library
A router library
A form validation library
A server-side rendering library

questions.question: What is the difference between props and state in Vue JS?
options: Props are used for passing data between parent and child components, while state is used for managing data within a component
Props are used for managing data within a component, while state is used for passing data between parent and child components
Props and state are two different names for the same thing
Props and state are both used for managing data within a component
questions.answer: Props are used for passing data between parent and child components, while state is used for managing data within a component

questions.question: What is a computed property in Vue JS?
options: A property that is calculated based on other properties
A property that is set in the Vue instance
A property that is used to define the template of a component
A property that is used to define a method in a component
questions.answer: A property that is calculated based on other properties

questions.question: What is the difference between v-bind and v-model in Vue JS?
options: v-bind is used for one-way data binding, while v-model is used for two-way data binding
v-bind is used for two-way data binding, while v-model is used for one-way data binding
v-bind and v-model are two different names for the same thing
v-bind and v-model are both used for managing data within a component
questions.answer: v-bind is used for one-way data binding, while v-model is used for two-way data binding

questions.question: What is a lifecycle hook in Vue JS?
options: A function that is called when a component is created, updated, or destroyed
A function that is called when an HTTP request is made
A function that is called when a user clicks on a button
A function that is called when a form is submitted
questions.answer: A function that is called when a component is created, updated, or destroyed

A directive for binding data to a form input

questions.question: What is the difference between a sync modifier and a .sync modifier in Vue JS?
options: There is no difference, sync and .sync are two different names for the same thing
A sync modifier updates the parent component's data when the child component's data changes, while a .sync modifier updates the child component's data when the parent component's data changes
A sync modifier updates the child component's data when the parent component's data changes, while a .sync modifier updates the parent component's data when the child component's data changes
A sync modifier and a .sync modifier are both used for updating data between parent and child components
questions.answer: A sync modifier updates the parent component's data when the child component's data changes, while a .sync modifier updates the child component's data when the parent component's data changes

questions.question: What is the difference between a mixin and an extension in Vue JS?
options: A mixin is a way to reuse code across multiple components, while an extension is a way to add functionality to a component
A mixin is a way to add functionality to a component, while an extension is a way to reuse code across multiple components
A mixin and an extension are two different names for the same thing
A mixin and an extension are both used for adding functionality to a component
questions.answer: A mixin is a way to reuse code across multiple components, while an extension is a way to add functionality to a component

questions.question: What is the difference between props and events in Vue JS?
options: Props are used for passing data from a parent component to a child component, while events are used for passing data from a child component to a parent component
Props and events are two different names for the same thing
Props and events are both used for passing data between parent and child components
Props are used for handling events, while events are used for passing data from a child component to a parent component
questions.answer: Props are used for passing data from a parent component to a child component, while events are used for passing data from a child component to a parent component

questions.question: What is the difference between a global component and a local component in Vue JS?
options: A global component is registered globally and can be used in any component, while a local component is registered locally and can only be used in the component where it is registered
A global component is registered locally and can only be used in the component where it is registered, while a local component is registered globally and can be used in any component
A global component and a local component are two different names for the same thing
A global component and a local component are both registered globally and can be used in any component
questions.answer: A global component is registered globally and can be used in any component, while a local component is registered locally and can only be used in the component where it is registered
